method: Coarsely grate the potatoes and onion into a clean tea towel and then squeeze out the excess liquid by twisting the towel. Place the mix in a large bowl. Add the egg, a good couple of pinches of salt and freshly ground black pepper. Mix the ingredients well. (You need to salt the mix well otherwise the hash browns can be quite bland). Heat a good glug of oil in a heavy based frying pan and when the oil is hot (but not smoking), add spoonfuls of the potato mixture into the pan and flatten into patties about 1cm thick. Flip over once browned and crispy - about 2-3 minutes each side. Serve hot as a breakfast or supper side dish. Especially good with bacon and eggs.
ingredients: 1 egg, beaten,  4 medium potatoes, peeled (like maris piper or king Edwards),  1 medium onion,  salt and pepper,  vegetable oil for frying
